answers.author: Christine Thompson
answers.text:
Mark,
We are currently running an 8 week step contest and many of our elected officials are participating.  We may be a bit unique however in that we have several elected officials who are extremely active (marathons, biking, etc) and were former military.  We have 3 activity levels participants self designate.  One of our elected won the first week in the highest activity level. I do not personally see any downsides and I have yet to hear any from others.  We are in our 4th week.  Feel free to contact me if you'd like more information on our endeavors!
Christine

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Our county has put on a number of wellness competitions and other activities with employees.  I was wondering if anyone has experience involving elected board or council members?  It seems like it would be a great way to allow board members an opportunity to get first hand involvement in wellness/prevention programming.  This could help reinforce or strengthen support for such programs.  Before doing this I would like to get some feedback on what other communities may have experienced with this, specifically do you see any downsides?  Thanks.
title: Wellness competitions with board or council members?
